intro: Jacquemontia simulata, commonly known as the yellow balsam, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and other vines. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Jacquemontia simulata is an herbaceous perennial that can grow up to 2 meters in height, often climbing or trailing along the ground.
